com.kremerk.Sqlite
Class SqlExecutor<T>

java.lang.Object
  com.kremerk.Sqlite.SqlExecutor<T>
Type Parameters:
T - A class that is a POJO that "maps" to a table in the database.
public class SqlExecutor<T>
extends java.lang.Object

Used to continue a SqlStatement to interact with the database.

Typically this class is not instantiated outright, instead use SqlStatement.select(Class), SqlStatement.update(Object), SqlStatement.insert(Object), SqlStatement.delete(Class), or SqlStatement.delete(Object) to create an instance of this class.

join

public SqlExecutor<T> join(java.lang.Class<?> leftClazz,
                           java.lang.String leftField,
                           java.lang.Class<?> rightClazz,
                           java.lang.String rightField)
Used to do a SQL Join with another POJO/Table.

A simple example of using joining to get all of a user's things, given the user's name: 

 new SqlStatement().select(Thing.class).join(User.class, "id", Thing.class, "userId")
                                       .where(User.class, "name").eq("Bob").getList()

Parameters:
leftClazz - The (left) class/table you're joining to.
leftField - The field in the left class/table you're joining on.
rightClazz - The (right) class/table you're joining from.
rightField - The field in the right class/table you're joining on.
Returns:
A SqlExecutor used for function chaining.

join

public SqlExecutor<T> join(java.lang.Class<?> leftClazz,
                           java.lang.String leftField,
                           java.lang.Class<?> rightClazz,
                           java.lang.String rightField,
                           JoinExecutor.JoinType joinType)
Used to do a SQL Join with another POJO/Table, with specifying the JoinExecutor.JoinType

A simple example of using joining to get all of a user's things, given the user's name: 

 new SqlStatement().select(Thing.class).join(User.class, "id", Thing.class, "userId")
                                       .where(User.class, "name").eq("Bob").getList()

Parameters:
leftClazz - The (left) class/table you're joining to.
leftField - The field in the left class/table you're joining on.
rightClazz - The (right) class/table you're joining from.
rightField - The field in the right class/table you're joining on.
joinType - The JoinExecutor.JoinType that the join should use.
Returns:
A SqlExecutor used for function chaining.

from

public SqlExecutor<T> from(java.lang.Object object)
                    throws DataConnectionException
Allows to select a List of Objects of type T (as specified by class type passed into select(Class)) from the POJO passed into this method. The POJO that is passed in must have a OneToMany relationship setup in it to property have this method work.

You can use the returned SqlExecutor object to limit the resulting list by chaining a where clause after this method.

Example usage would be: 

 User nick = new SqlStatement().select(User.class).where("name").eq("Nick");
 List<Thing> nicksThings = new SqlStatement().select(Thing.class).from(nick).getList();

If you only wanted the things where it's value was 5 you could do: 

 User nick = new SqlStatement().select(User.class).where("name").eq("Nick");
 List<Thing> nicksThings = new SqlStatement().select(Thing.class).from(nick).where("value").eq(5).getList();

See OneToMany for more information on setting up this relationship.

Throws:
DataConnectionException

where

public WhereExecutor<T> where(java.lang.String field)
                       throws DataConnectionException
Used to start a "where clause" when querying/updating/deleting for an Object from the database. This will return a WhereExecutor that is used to in conjunction with the where to limit your database call. Additional fields can be added to your "where clause" by using the and(String) method.

Parameters:
field - The field of the object/database table you want to limit by.
Returns:
a WhereExecutor to be used in conjunction with the where method.
Throws:
DataConnectionException

where

public WhereExecutor<T> where(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                              java.lang.String field)
                       throws DataConnectionException
Used to start a "where clause" when querying/updating/deleting for an Object from the database. This will return a WhereExecutor that is used to in conjunction with the where to limit your database call. Additional fields can be added to your "where clause" by using the and(String) method.

This version is to explicitly state what Entity the field belongs to. This is typically needed when doing a join.

Parameters:
clazz - The class who the field belongs to.
field - The field of the object/database table you want to limit by.
Returns:
a WhereExecutor to be used in conjunction with the where method.
Throws:
DataConnectionException

and

public WhereExecutor<T> and(java.lang.String field)

Parameters:
field - Additional fields of the object/database table you want to limit by.
Returns:
A WhereExecutor to be used in conjunction with the and method.

orderBy

public SqlExecutor<T> orderBy(java.lang.String field)
Used to sort the resulting list of Objects from the query. By default, the order will be ordered in ascending order by the field passed in. If you want to sort in descending order, use desc() after calling this method.

Parameters:
field - The field of the object/database table you want to sort the resulting list by.
Returns:
A SqlExecutor used for function chaining.

asc

public SqlExecutor<T> asc()
Used to explicitly say you want to sort in ascending order. Works in conjunction with orderBy(String).

Returns:
A SqlExecutor used for function chaining.

desc

public SqlExecutor<T> desc()
Used to sort in descending order. Works in conjunction with orderBy(String).

Returns:
A SqlExecutor used for function chaining.

getList

public java.util.List<T> getList()
                          throws DataConnectionException

Returns:
A List of Objects of type T that is the result from querying the database.

getFirst

public T getFirst()
           throws DataConnectionException
A convenience method to return the first object of a given query which would normally be returned by getList().

Returns:
An object of type T that is the result of querying the database.
Throws:
DataConnectionException

getColumns

public java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> getColumns(ColumnExpression columnExpression)
                                                                            throws DataConnectionException
Returns a List of Maps which map from a field/database table column for the resulting query along with the passed in ColumnExpression.

The value of the map is of type Object and will need to be cast to the type of value you're expecting from the fields/columns you specified in your ColumnExpression.

Parameters:
columnExpression - A map expression to specify what columns you want back from the database.
Returns:
A List of Maps which are the result of the query with the passed in ColumnExpression.
Throws:
DataConnectionException
